pullRequest.body:
In the category of types: limits of shape `SingleObj M` are fixed points, colimits are quotients.

---

nodes.body: :v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7766877618/job/21183174419)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7766877618/job/21183174274)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7766877618/job/21183174368)
Does `@[simps]` generate useful simp-lemmas for this def? Idem for other defs...

For the ones about limits, yes. For the ones about colimits: Not sure, but the alternative simp lemma that I came up with is: `∀ x : J.obj (SingleObj.star G), Types.colimitEquivQuotient J (colimit.ι J (SingleObj.star G) x) = ⟦x⟧` is solved by simp if I add `@[simps!]` to `colimitEquivQuotient`, so I suppose simply adding `@[simps!]` is fine?

If you don't like the simp-lemmas that are auto-generated, you can of course manually prove better ones. But if you are reasonably happy with what `simps!` does, then I suggest we just move on. We can always come back and state manual simp-lemmas.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/SingleObj): characterise (co)limits of shape `SingleObj M` in types
